text:
Taylor Swift dropped another catchy bop from her upcoming album, Reputation, last night. It's called "Gorgeous," and the beginning of the song starts out with a baby—like, an actual baby—cooing the word gorgeous. Swift teased this detail about the track hours before she released it, but that's not stopping fans from obsessing to the max. Why did she make this call? And, more important, who the hell is the baby?

Twitter might have the answer to that second question. The dominant fan theory with Swifties on social media right now is that Blake Lively and Ryan Reynolds' daughter, James, is the one saying "gorgeous."

"It is rumoured that the child’s voice at the start of Taylor’s Swift’s new song, #Gorgeous is Blake and Ryan’s daughter James," a tweet from a Lively news Twitter handle reads. See it for yourself, below:
title: Fans Think Blake Lively's Daughter Is the One Saying 'Gorgeous' in Taylor Swift's New Song
